SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.gameplay

Class LevelParent

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.observer.Observable
com.example.demo.gameplay.LevelParent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
Direct Known Subclasses:
LevelOne, LevelThree, LevelTwo
public abstract class LevelParent extends Observable implements Observer
Abstract base class for game levels. Manages game state, actors, UI components, and interactions for a specific level.

This class extends Observable to notify observers of level-related events and implements Observer to respond to game state changes.

    • LevelParent

      public LevelParent(String backgroundImageName, double screenHeight, double screenWidth, int playerInitialHealth, javafx.stage.Stage stage, String levelName)
      Constructs a LevelParent instance with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      backgroundImageName - Path to the level's background image.
      screenHeight - Height of the screen.
      screenWidth - Width of the screen.
      playerInitialHealth - Initial health of the player.
      stage - The game stage.
      levelName - Name of the level.

    • getProjectileManager

      public ProjectileManager getProjectileManager()
      Retrieves the ProjectileManager instance. The ProjectileManager handles all projectiles in the game, including creation, updates, and removal.
      Returns:
      The ProjectileManager instance used by this level.

    • startGame

      public void startGame(String levelName)
      Starts the game for the current level. Displays level information and transitions to the PLAYING state.
      Parameters:
      levelName - Name of the level to start.

    • update

      public void update(Object arg)
      Updates the state of the level based on changes to the game state. This method is triggered when the GameStateManager notifies its observers of a state change. The state dictates how the game level should behave (e.g., play, pause, win, or lose).
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      arg - The updated game state, provided as an instance of GameStateManager.GameState. If the argument is not of the correct type, this method does nothing.

    • goToNextLevel

      public void goToNextLevel(String levelName)
      Transitions the game to the next level by cleaning up the current level and initializing the necessary components for the new level.

      This method performs the following actions:

      • Unregisters the current level as an observer.
      • Clears all projectiles, enemies, and power-ups from the game.
      • Stops background music and the game loop timeline.
      • Resets the UIManager and initializes the new UI elements.
      • Notifies observers about the new level name.
      • Sets the game state to INITIALIZING for the new level.
      Parameters:
      levelName - The name of the next level to load.

    • togglePause

      public void togglePause()
      Toggles the pause state of the game. If the game is currently paused, it resumes the game. If the game is running, it pauses the game.

      This method notifies all observers of the toggle action using the "TOGGLE_PAUSE" message.

    • resumeGame

      public void resumeGame()
      Resumes the game by restarting the timeline, updating the game state, and hiding the pause menu.

    • winGame

      protected void winGame()
      Ends the game with a win state. Displays the "You Win" screen and transitions to the end game menu.

    • loseGame

      protected void loseGame()
      Ends the game with a game-over state. Displays the "Game Over" screen and transitions to the end game menu.

    • goToMainMenu

      public void goToMainMenu(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Cleans up resources and observers before transitioning to the main menu.
      Parameters:
      stage - The game stage.

    • addProjectile

      public void addProjectile(ActiveActorDestructible projectile)
      Adds a projectile fired by the user to the scene and tracks it.
      Parameters:
      projectile - The projectile to add.

    • getSoundManager

      Retrieves the instance of the SoundManager for managing sound effects and music.
      Returns:
      The SoundManager instance used in the level.

    • getUser

      public UserSuperman getUser()
      Retrieves the instance of the user's character (UserSuperman).
      Returns:
      The UserSuperman instance representing the player's character.

    • getRoot

      public javafx.scene.Group getRoot()
      Retrieves the root Group for the current level. This group contains all the visual elements of the level.
      Returns:
      The root Group of the current level.

    • getEnemyMaximumYPosition

      protected double getEnemyMaximumYPosition()
      Retrieves the maximum Y-coordinate position that enemies can reach before being considered out of bounds.
      Returns:
      The maximum Y-coordinate for enemy movement.

    • getScreenWidth

      public double getScreenWidth()
      Retrieves the width of the game screen.
      Returns:
      The width of the screen in pixels.

    • getScreenHeight

      public double getScreenHeight()
      Retrieves the height of the game screen.
      Returns:
      The height of the screen in pixels.

    • userIsDestroyed

      protected boolean userIsDestroyed()
      Checks if the user's character (UserSuperman) has been destroyed.
      Returns:
      true if the user is destroyed; false otherwise.

    • cleanup

      public void cleanup()
      Cleans up resources and unregisters observers. This is typically called when transitioning between levels or exiting the game.

    • isPaused

      public boolean isPaused()
      Checks whether the game is currently paused.
      Returns:
      true if the game is paused, false otherwise.

    • getEnemyManager

      public EnemyManager getEnemyManager()
      Retrieves the enemy manager responsible for managing all enemy units in the game.
      Returns:
      The EnemyManager instance used to manage enemies.

    • getGameStateManager

      public GameStateManager getGameStateManager()
      Retrieves the game state manager that handles the game's current state, such as running, paused, or game over.
      Returns:
      The GameStateManager instance managing the game's state.
